alert.note: Alert for Clay (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued December 10 at 3:02AM EST until December 10 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM EST/215 AM CST/ FOR NORTHEASTERN HENRY...NORTHWESTERN CLAY AND SOUTHWESTERN QUITMAN COUNTIES... At 301 AM EST/201 AM CST/, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 8 miles south of Georgetown, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Coates, Wire Bridge, Bagby State Park, Bonapartes Retreat, Hatcher, Crossroads, and Ricks Place. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
